body_html: @roumposg yeah, i understand that, but if we can have a labels feature column containing dimension 1 value, with ["label1=label2", "label2=label5"] and user can specify = as the label_separator, the multi_label_head interface would be more consistent with other heads, which accept dense tensor
body_text: @roumposg yeah, i understand that, but if we can have a labels feature column containing dimension 1 value, with ["label1=label2", "label2=label5"]  and user can specify = as the label_separator,  the multi_label_head interface would be more consistent with other heads, which accept dense tensor
body: @roumposg yeah, i understand that, but if we can have a labels feature column containing dimension 1 value, with `["label1=label2", "label2=label5"] ` and user can specify `=` as the `label_separator`,  the `multi_label_head` interface would be more consistent with other heads, which accept dense tensor
